intro: Jacquemontia alba, commonly known as the white jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and bindweeds. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy white to pale yellow flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in forested areas. Jacquemontia alba is often found in wetland habitats and is considered a perennial herb.
